forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 63 in the afternoon. West wind around 21 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind 10 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

weather_report:
The air in Downtown San Francisco carries a crisp clarity this afternoon, with the sun shining brightly over the city. Although the temperature is leisurely nudging towards the mid-60s, gusts of wind dance around at a steady pace, bringing a refreshing chill that reminds one the bay is close at hand. The forecast suggests that as daylight wanes, the air will cool down even further, settling around 54 degrees. Tonight will strike a balance between light and dark, with only a few clouds gracing the sky and allowing for glimpses of stars to emerge as the evening deepens.

Currently, you may notice a distinct absence of fog, a welcome sight for those who want to embrace the warmth of the sun without the damp embrace of a typical coastal haze. As the marine layer momentarily holds back, it’s a good time to slip into comfortable layers—perhaps a light sweater for the evening’s chill, complemented by a casual pair of trousers or jeans to absorb the briskness. For those looking for quiet, contemplative activities, a stroll along the waterfront, taking in the vibrant life surrounding you, could be immensely satisfying. Alternatively, you might find joy in a cozy café, sipping a warm drink while people-watching, whether the sun continues to linger or the cool air gently nudges into the night.
